item.title: Using a standard mysql function returns an error
item.description: While running some mysql scripts I suddenly hit the following error: ERROR 1305 (42000) at line 1: FUNCTION somedatabase.find_in_set does not exist Since find_in_set is a standard function I was kind of puzzled, especially since I ran the same script before on some other servers without error.Â Checking the SQL script I found the issue: I had update [blah blah] where find_in_set (id,(select [more blah[)) from [rest of blag]; and it has to be
